<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/head-of-instagram-hits-pause-on-instagram-kids-after-a-lot-of-pushback?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Insta Kids Are Not Alright
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/head-of-instagram-hits-pause-on-instagram-kids-after-a-lot-of-pushback?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Toy block with instagram logo on top of phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/15943ca4b02adf88b0ff1bf7e4482fbe16e0c042-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook, like so many of us after one bad summer camp gig, has pumped the brakes on its plans to work with kids. The head of FB-owned Instagram, Adam Mosseri, <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/instagram-kids-app-backlash-pause-development-1235075039/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that the company would be pausing development for “Instagram Kids,” a version of its platform for users under 13.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you think babies who can use iPhones are scary, just wait until you hear about how terrified people are of tweens navigating social media.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In May, 44 attorneys general </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/attorneys-general-ask-facebook-drop-plans-instagram-kids?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a></span><span> Mark Zuckerberg to abandon the idea, arguing that 13 was too young to deal with the wide world of targeted ads and internet trolls. The AGs cited studies showing how social media negatively impacted children’s health.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then, a few weeks ago, a WSJ investigation <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-facebook-files-11631713039?mod=series_facebookfiles&mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> that Facebook knew Instagram was harmful to its users but decided not to do anything about it. The most relevant insight: Facebook’s internal research showed that Instagram made body image issues worse for one in three teen girls, and called Instagram “toxic.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a </span><span><a href="https://about.fb.com/news/2021/09/research-teen-well-being-and-instagram/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a></span><span> rebutting the investigation, Facebook’s Head of Research Pratiti Raychoudhury pushed back on the WSJ’s accusations, saying that its platforms were not toxic.</span>
</li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not goodbye, just see you later</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instagram’s Mosseri wrote in a blog post that, “While we stand by the need to develop this experience”—a platform specifically geared toward youngsters where parents can monitor who slides into their kids’ DMs—the company wants more time to convince parents, experts, and regulators this is a good idea. It'll be an uphill battle: Some lawmakers are <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/27/22696698/facebook-instagram-for-kids-mosseri-markey-blumenthal-blackburn-pause?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">saying</a> that the Instagram for kids concept should be scrapped all together.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Facebook’s global head of safety, Antigone Davis, will testify Thursday in a Senate hearing addressing Facebook’s research into kids' health and safety on its apps.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>If Instagram for kids doesn’t work out, Facebook still has the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/27/22696578/facebook-metaverse-ar-vr-fund-research-definition?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">metaverse</a>. And yesterday it announced a $50 million investment into building its metaverse “responsibly.” <em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/two-fed-leaders-announce-retirement-on-the-same-day?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fed Leaders Hit the Links
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/two-fed-leaders-announce-retirement-on-the-same-day?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/8f8741278c3a730829dbc6254c1d78de4c315f06-1024x741.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren. Jessica Rinaldi for The Boston Globe via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not one, but two Federal Reserve leaders—Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan and Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren—<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/27/dallas-fed-president-kaplan-to-retire-early-on-oct-8-citing-trading-disclosure-distraction.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced their retirement</a> yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good deal on a Winnebago? </strong>Not exactly. Both Kaplan and Rosengren have come under fire after new disclosures showed they were active traders while determining the country’s monetary policy. Kaplan especially was #buyingthedip—he executed big trades in stocks such as Amazon, Apple, and Delta last year as the Fed flooded the market with liquidity.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kaplan </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/kaplan-steps-down-as-dallas-fed-chief-hours-after-rosengren?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">directly linked</a></span><span> the trading controversy to his retirement: “Unfortunately, the recent focus on my financial disclosure risks becoming a distraction” to the Fed’s work.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rosengren didn’t mention his stock trading. He cited health reasons for his early retirement.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier this month, both Kaplan and Rosengren said they would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/two-regional-fed-chiefs-to-sell-stocks-to-avoid-any-appearance-of-conflict-of-interest-11631226416?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sell their stocks</a> to avoid any conflicts of interest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>At a press conference last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell made clear he was not pleased about the stock trading controversy, and pledged to look into the Fed’s ethics guidelines. “I think no one is happy,” <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/powell-says-fed-is-taking-questions-about-officials-trading-very-seriously-11632350823?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he said</a>. <em>—NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/south-korea-s-squid-game-surges-to-no-1-spot-on-netflix-leaderboard?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Do You Want to Play a 'Squid Game'?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/south-korea-s-squid-game-surges-to-no-1-spot-on-netflix-leaderboard?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A still shot from the show Squid Game " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0d42ee805d3419463b6a69c8b921b324148d9f89-600x399.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The No. 1 show on Netflix right now isn’t <em>Cocomelon </em>or <em>Sex Education</em>, but instead a South Korean thriller called <a href="https://variety.com/2021/global/asia/squid-game-director-hwang-dong-hyuk-korean-series-global-success-1235073355/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Squid Game</em></a>. It’s the first South Korean TV show to hit the top spot on Netflix, and its success highlights the growing influence of K-drama on the global entertainment stage.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is <em>Squid Game</em>? </strong>The prequel to <em>My Octopus Teacher</em>. JK—it portrays a Hunger Games-esque competition where contestants compete in highly dangerous events for the opportunity to win more than $40 million in prizes.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Catching the <em>Squid </em>fever</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some companies with ink in <em>Squid Game </em>are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/top-netflix-hit-squid-game-provides-spark-for-korean-stocks?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surging in share price</a>. Bucket Studio, which has a stake in an agency representing the show’s lead actor, has exploded more than 70% over the past three trading sessions, per Bloomberg.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Squid </em>hype has even jumped platforms, with fans <a href="https://www.ign.com/articles/squid-game-netflix-roblox-remake?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">replicating</a> the show’s deadly competitions in Roblox.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>From “Gangnam Style” to BTS to <em>Parasite</em>, South Korean culture has gained a foothold in the US over the last decade. One analyst told Bloomberg that Korean companies could pose a “serious competitive threat” to Hollywood powerhouse studios.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a lot of talk about what to look for when you’re ready for your next career move. Honestly, don’t listen to it. Take the role where you feel seen, challenged, and can make an impact from the start.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/506569905;313974931;u?https://www.capitalonecareers.com/?utm_source=Morning%20Brew&utm_medium=display&utm_campaign=Talent_Brand&utm_content=niche_site&utm_term=313974931&ss=paid" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A place like Capital One</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They don’t just want you to work <em>for</em> them. They want you to work <em>with</em> them. And, as they keep working to change banking for good, they’re building a team as diverse as the customers they serve every day.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Capital One is looking for people with forward-thinking ideas that create meaningful change in the lives of their customers and communities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not only will you thrive in your new role, Capital One will invest in you with leadership training, mentoring, and personal development programs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Capital One is invested in your future. Because they know it only takes one person to change banking and create a more equitable future for all.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/506569905;313974931;u?https://www.capitalonecareers.com/?utm_source=Morning%20Brew&utm_medium=display&utm_campaign=Talent_Brand&utm_content=niche_site&utm_term=313974931&ss=paid" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more about careers at Capital One</a>, or keep reading for more info.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/key-performance-indicators-september-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators

</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>TikTok said it has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/tiktok-hits-1-billion-monthly-active-users-globally-company-2021-09-27/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1 billion monthly active users</a> globally, a 45% jump from July 2020 and a <em>much </em>bigger jump from January 2018, when it had just 55 million. Here’s where the rest of the social media platforms <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1442525695725346821?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stack up</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“This is by far the highest-profile, post-Me Too conviction involving sexual abuse that we’ve seen in the music industry.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT’s Joe Coscarelli put R. Kelly’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/09/27/nyregion/r-kelly-trial-news?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">conviction</a> yesterday into perspective. The singer, accused for decades of exploiting young women and children for sex, was found guilty on all charges of racketeering and sex trafficking brought against him. The big question facing the industry now is, will streamers like Spotify and Apple Music remove R. Kelly’s music from their platforms?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Goldman Sachs, Ozy Media, and a $40 million conference call gone wrong. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/26/business/media/ozy-media-goldman-sachs.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqohkQVUZBSbfQMMmqBCdnr_KzbA9jzj5PjnQTDtOzu1QDI-E90LEY-94btAzxHKbWNpFevcJdcBF89V-bQZrWhX65dyNgogEKCE47o6-BTs6j5uXGL1grWWvMzfkeKJ1mOzv-k3eb2K5WPCJgnEmLB134scwLSHc0n0Kxq7HEOJ_y4M-ia9nXsYmMG9GMCqavPDoCwF8MMGGaHzf7Ao0U-JYX1LDjILWquJAIEgJVwWwHD4o6n086dhfJNsVIK78ShYlc8P1ir8bYXd6wqlGnTRgwP8V_z49CDnw1A&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/investing-is-so-easy-a-hamster-can-do-it?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Investing Is So Easy a Hamster Can Do It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/27/investing-is-so-easy-a-hamster-can-do-it?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A hamster stands next to a chart bearing an upward arrow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1c63ca50e41dbf31b9a8a1cce255dc32e5caea9e-2400x1600.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new star investor is turning heads in the world of crypto. Mr. Goxx's portfolio is up about 20% since he started trading in June, <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-58707641?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outperforming</a> Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, bitcoin, and the S&P 500.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thing is, Mr. Goxx is doing all this with a brain about the size of an Altoid. Because he’s a hamster.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mr. Goxx works out of a <a href="https://twitter.com/mrgoxx/status/1415982231651225600?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">high-tech office </a>in Germany and makes his picks by running on a wheel, which selects a particular crypto, then running through one of two tunnels, which decides whether the asset is bought or sold.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Animal traders, a history: </strong>Crypto-picking hamsters are a new addition to a long-standing theory that random chance is as reliable an investment strategy as any expert’s picks. In his 1973 book <em>A Random Walk Down Wall Street</em>, economist Burton Malkiel wrote, “A blindfolded monkey throwing darts...could select a portfolio that would do just as well as one carefully selected by experts.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The theory was tested <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/random-darts-beat-hedge-fund-stars-again-2019-06-26?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in 2018</a> by Wall Street Journal writers who made stock selections by throwing darts at a board. After a year, the dartboard selections beat the pros by 27%. <em>—MK</em></p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Need some tips on building your dream team? The <em>Founder’s Journal</em> podcast is covering everything you need to succeed this week—from nurturing your hires to answering the age-old question, “Should I hire my friend?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/7tadV3_V?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Make sure you're subscribed to Founder's Journal wherever you get your podcasts</a>—your career could depend on it.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

one bad summer camp gig, has pumped the brakes on its plans to work with kids. The head of FB-owned Instagram, Adam Mosseri, \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/instagram-kids-app-backlash-pause-development-1235075039/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that the company would be pausing development for “Instagram Kids,” a version of its platform for users under 13.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you think babies who can use iPhones are scary, just wait until you hear about how terrified people are of tweens navigating social media.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn May, 44 attorneys general \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/attorneys-general-ask-facebook-drop-plans-instagram-kids?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Mark Zuckerberg to abandon the idea, arguing that 13 was too young to deal with the wide world of targeted ads and internet trolls. The AGs cited studies showing how social media negatively impacted children’s health.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen, a few weeks ago, a WSJ investigation \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-facebook-files-11631713039?mod=series_facebookfiles\u0026mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e that Facebook knew Instagram was harmful to its users but decided not to do anything about it. The most relevant insight: Facebook’s internal research showed that Instagram made body image issues worse for one in three teen girls, and called Instagram “toxic.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2021/09/research-teen-well-being-and-instagram/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e rebutting the investigation, Facebook’s Head of Research Pratiti Raychoudhury pushed back on the WSJ’s accusations, saying that its platforms were not toxic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not goodbye, just see you later\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInstagram’s Mosseri wrote in a blog post that, “While we stand by the need to develop this experience”—a platform specifically geared toward youngsters where parents can monitor who slides into their kids’ DMs—the company wants more time to convince parents, experts, and regulators this is a good idea. It'll be an uphill battle: Some lawmakers are \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/27/22696698/facebook-instagram-for-kids-mosseri-markey-blumenthal-blackburn-pause?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaying\u003c/a\u003e that the Instagram for kids concept should be scrapped all together.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eFacebook’s global head of safety, Antigone Davis, will testify Thursday in a Senate hearing addressing Facebook’s research into kids' health and safety on its apps.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eIf Instagram for kids doesn’t work out, Facebook still has the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/27/22696578/facebook-metaverse-ar-vr-fund-research-definition?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emetaverse\u003c/a\u003e. And yesterday it announced a $50 million investment into building its metaverse “responsibly.” \u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBoston Fed President Eric Rosengren. Jessica Rinaldi for The Boston Globe via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot one, but two Federal Reserve leaders—Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan and Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren—\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/27/dallas-fed-president-kaplan-to-retire-early-on-oct-8-citing-trading-disclosure-distraction.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced their retirement\u003c/a\u003e yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood deal on a Winnebago? \u003c/strong\u003eNot exactly. Both Kaplan and Rosengren have come under fire after new disclosures showed they were active traders while determining the country’s monetary policy. Kaplan especially was #buyingthedip—he executed big trades in stocks such as Amazon, Apple, and Delta last year as the Fed flooded the market with liquidity.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eKaplan \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/kaplan-steps-down-as-dallas-fed-chief-hours-after-rosengren?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirectly linked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the trading controversy to his retirement: “Unfortunately, the recent focus on my financial disclosure risks becoming a distraction” to the Fed’s work.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRosengren didn’t mention his stock trading. He cited health reasons for his early retirement.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier this month, both Kaplan and Rosengren said they would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/two-regional-fed-chiefs-to-sell-stocks-to-avoid-any-appearance-of-conflict-of-interest-11631226416?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esell their stocks\u003c/a\u003e to avoid any conflicts of interest.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAt a press conference last week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell made clear he was not pleased about the stock trading controversy, and pledged to look into the Fed’s ethics guidelines. “I think no one is happy,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/powell-says-fed-is-taking-questions-about-officials-trading-very-seriously-11632350823?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe said\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cem\u003e—NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS href=\"https://variety.com/2021/global/asia/squid-game-director-hwang-dong-hyuk-korean-series-global-success-1235073355/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" It’s the first South Korean TV show to hit the top spot on Netflix, and its success highlights the growing influence of K-drama on the global entertainment stage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is \u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e? \u003c/strong\u003eThe prequel to \u003cem\u003eMy Octopus Teacher\u003c/em\u003e. JK—it portrays a Hunger Games-esque competition where contestants compete in highly dangerous events for the opportunity to win more than $40 million in prizes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCatching the \u003cem\u003eSquid \u003c/em\u003efever\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome companies with ink in \u003cem\u003eSquid Game \u003c/em\u003eare \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/top-netflix-hit-squid-game-provides-spark-for-korean-stocks?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurging in share price\u003c/a\u003e. Bucket Studio, which has a stake in an agency representing the show’s lead actor, has exploded more than 70% over the past three trading sessions, per Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSquid \u003c/em\u003ehype has even jumped platforms, with fans \u003ca href=\"https://www.ign.com/articles/squid-game-netflix-roblox-remake?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereplicating\u003c/a\u003e the show’s deadly competitions in Roblox.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom “Gangnam Style” to BTS to \u003cem\u003eParasite\u003c/em\u003e, South Korean culture has gained a foothold in the US over the last decade. One analyst told Bloomberg that Korean companies could pose a “serious competitive threat” to Hollywood powerhouse studios.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new star investor is turning heads in the world of crypto. Mr. Goxx's portfolio is up about 20% since he started trading in June, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-58707641?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutperforming\u003c/a\u003e Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, bitcoin, and the S\u0026P 500.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThing is, Mr. Goxx is doing all this with a brain about the size of an Altoid. Because he’s a hamster.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMr. Goxx works out of a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/mrgoxx/status/1415982231651225600?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigh-tech office \u003c/a\u003ein Germany and makes his picks by running on a wheel, which selects a particular crypto, then running through one of two tunnels, which decides whether the asset is bought or sold.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnimal traders, a history: \u003c/strong\u003eCrypto-picking hamsters are a new addition to a long-standing theory that random chance is as reliable an investment strategy as any expert’s picks. In his 1973 book \u003cem\u003eA Random Walk Down Wall Street\u003c/em\u003e, economist Burton Malkiel wrote, “A blindfolded monkey throwing darts...could select a portfolio that would do just as well as one carefully selected by experts.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe theory was tested \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/random-darts-beat-hedge-fund-stars-again-2019-06-26?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein 2018\u003c/a\u003e by Wall Street Journal writers who made stock selections by throwing darts at a board. After a year, the dartboard selections beat the pros by 27%. \u003cem\u003e—MK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
